main event: On March 1, 1952, the pilot and crew of a C-54 type troop carrier squadron sighted an unidentified flying object over the Sea of Japan while returning to Ashiya Air Base.
interesting points: The object appeared oval-shaped and bright orange in color, with a 50-foot trail, gradually fading from sight.
The crew, including the pilot and co-pilot, concurred with the sighting and were very impressed, almost forgetting to land the aircraft.
The pilot stated that the object was definitely not a jet aircraft, as he had prior experience observing jets operating with afterburners during periods of darkness.
The object was observed at an altitude of 11,500 feet, heading 220 degrees, while the C-54 was turning to 300 degrees.
The maneuvering and speed of the object, along with its elliptical shape and bright white color, were documented in the report.
witnesses: pilot, co-pilot, and engineer of the C-54 troop carrier squadron
photographs: no, the report does not mention the presence of photographs
